}} The 'Football League Championship' (often referred to as the 'Championship'
for short, or the '[[Sky Bet]] Championship' for sponsorship reasons ) is the highest division of The Football League and second-
highest division overall in the English football league system after the
Premier League.

The Football League Championship was introduced for the 2004â05 season, having
been previously known as the Football League First Division. According to
Deloitte, in the 2004â05 season it was the wealthiest non-top flight football
division in the world, and the sixth richest division in
Europe. [http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/business/5032978.stm First fall in
Premiership wages], BBC News, 31 May 2006, reporting on Deloitte's review of
football finance in 2004â05

The winners of the Football League Championship receive the Football League
Championship trophy which is the same trophy as the old First Division champions
were handed prior to the Premier League's inception in the 1992â93 season.

At present (2012–13 season), Ipswich Town hold the longest tenure in the
Championship, last being out of the division in the 2001â02 season when they
were relegated from the Premier League.
